definition: the impact of a piece of writing on the reader/gentle/refined
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: The theory of "Wen-qi" nearly rurs through the whole Chinese classical literature .
sentences.chinese: “文氣”說幾乎貫穿中國古典文論的始終。

sentences.english: Just a normal - kind of nerdy - American. Sociable, Easy to get along with.
sentences.chinese: 正常有點文氣的美國人，好交際，容易相處。

sentences.english: All these study has been expanded theoretical research of"Wenqi".
sentences.chinese: 凡此種種，都使文氣理論研究得到了拓展。

sentences.english: Her new glasses make her look rather owlish .
sentences.chinese: 她戴著新眼鏡看上去很文氣。

definition: properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥帖
one's four limbs/two arms and two legs
refined and elegant attitude of mind
to polish a text/rhetoric/ornate language/to use florid language to conceal errors/to gloss over
